channel.title: Comments for page "Summon Order"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Summon Order"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
The way I look at it, there are 4 different categories of Kaiju.

- Major Kaiju (hardest to kill, need Elemental Beacon and MONSTER summon)
- Custom Kaiju (unique Kaiju tailored to players as thank you's/contest winners)
- Kaiju (normal summons. they are the 'default'.)
- Player Kaiju (will be summoned in order one time directly at the end of the custom kaiju summon order, then can appear randomly like a regular kaiju)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
i think the customkais should be the only ones to have custom pages. and yes, that is a very poor joke. >_>
as for playerkais and nonplayer kais, just a list. If its a non-player major, then custom page. custom and major kaijus, in my opinion, are the ONLY kaiju that deserve to be pointed out/honored with a custom page on the wiki.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Yes, I understand all mentioned things, I hope this will help others too:)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: PlayerKai is the model that all kaiju that players have created by completing the Impossible Mission are based on, they have identical health and difficulty with a random stat chosen. the "Player kaiju" that you see at the Kaiju page is a list of MOST of the people who have completed the Impossible Mission because it would be VERY cumbersome to put all 300 some odd people who have "Player Kai"'s in their own individual pages, not to mention a waste of time because any given generic playerkai they only have a minimal chance to be summoned.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Not exactly. PlayerKai is just short for Player Kaiju, which is any player that got a kaiju, typically speaking that from the 'impossible mission'. Custom Kaiju are the list of players that got special kaiju and that's what makes the summon order. Whether or not it's smart to call customkai a subset of playerkai is not important… just gotta know the difference. Sometimes people on the wiki will have made mistakes. Some of these pages are very old so they may have been fine at the time but are unclear now. If you see something that needs updating, go ahead…
Vampires, etc, are just non-player Minor Kaiju. All player kaiju and custom kaiju so far are also minor kaiju, but they're not simply the same thing.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Thanks a lot:) Just one more time noticed to maself that Player Kaiju and "PlayerKai" at wiki is very different things :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: It doesn't go on the summon order. The first kaiju that a village summons are all the player kaiju as posted, and then it goes into random kaiju that the village doesn't have the upgrade for. Being that Vampires isn't a player Kaiju it would AT THE EARLIEST in a fresh village would be 30th, but that is not garunteed.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Vampires is a kaiju but where is it's place in summon order should be then? :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Clarification of summon order, as according to Fax:

Basically, like this:
1. Check to see if village has Kaiju Corpse. If no, summon first custom on list that village is missing an upgrade for. If none, summon Playerkai. Else, go to next.
2. Check to see if MONSTER was used and village has Elemental Beacon. If so, add majorkai to the pool. Else, go to next.
3. Check to see if village has all kaiju upgrades. If no, summon randomly from pool of missing upgrades. (Only applies if village has never had upgrade before.) Else, go to next.
4. Failing that, summon a random kaiju from the pool.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
lol after 25 comes the other… 50 minus 25… the other 25 kaiju? lol, it used to be way more real kai than custom kai, but of course he's been adding custom kai like they're going out of fashion, so the summon order got so long…
And if you didn't know, the playerkai slot (1/50) means any random player who's gone kaiju… there are well over 300 of them, so yea, thank goodness they don't all have their own slot.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: is #25 ALWAYS A player kai followed by random kais on 26+. Or is that an error and actually 25+ is random (seems more reasonable)?
